availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ludwig "Lewis" M. Lawrence (Putnam Co. IN, shoemaker, Ky soldier (pvt. 1st Ky L.A))

body.p: Putnam County, Indiana, shoemaker and Kentucky soldier. Native of Baden, Germany. Married to Nancy Lawrence. Father of Joanna Lawrence. Shoemaker in Putnam County, Indiana, in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from April 5, 1862, to November 16, 1864. Prisoner of war at Murfreesboro, Tennessee, from July 13, 1862. Paroled at Camp Chase, Ohio, on July 15, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Putnam County, Jefferson, p. 227.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0146.
